DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether neuromuscular electrical stimulation can improve exercise tolerance for patients with heart failure and continuous dobutamine use in a hospital.
DOC.brief_title: Electrical Stimulation Improves Exercise Tolerance in Patients With Advanced Heart Failure on Continuous Dobutamine Use
DOC.criteria: Advanced heart failure (Stage D Left ventricle ejection fraction <30%) New York Heart Association class IIIIV Standard medical therapy for heart failure management Continuous inotropic infusion Unstable angina pectoris Recent (6 months) acute coronary syndrome Arrythmias Chronic renal failure Diabetes Mellitus Peripheral vascular diseases Inability to walk
